An easy example
Question 1 ◄ Questions ►
For the system of linear equations x − y = 7 y = −x + 5 which of the following moves is correct?
(a)
− y = x + 7 y = −x + 5
  (b)
− y = −x + 7 y = −x + 5
(c)
y = x + 7 y = −x + 5
  (d)
y = −x − 7 y = −x + 5

Choice (a) is Incorrect.
Choice (b) is Correct!
Choice (c) is Incorrect.
Choice (d) is Incorrect.
For the system of linear equations − y = −x + 7 y = −x + 5 which of the following moves is correct?
(a)
y = −x + 7 y = −x + 5
  (b)
− y = x + 7 y = −x + 5
(c)
y = x − 7 y = −x + 5
  (d)
− y = −x − 7 y = −x + 5

Choice (a) is Incorrect.
Choice (b) is Incorrect.
Choice (c) is Correct!
Choice (d) is Incorrect.
For the system of linear equations y = x − 7 y = −x + 5 which of the following moves is correct?
(a)
x − 7 = x + 5
  (b)
x − 7 = −x + 5
(c)
x + 7 = x + 5
  (d)
x − 7 = x − 5

Choice (a) is Incorrect.
Choice (b) is Correct!
Choice (c) is Incorrect.
Choice (d) is Incorrect.
For the linear equation x − 7 = −x + 5 which of the following moves is correct?
(a)
2x − 7 = 5
  (b)
− 7 = 5
(c)
− 7 = 2x + 5
  (d)
2x + 7 = 5
(e)
− 2x + 7 = 5
  (f)
− 2x − 7 = 5

Choice (a) is Correct!
Choice (b) is Incorrect.
Choice (c) is Incorrect.
Choice (d) is Incorrect.
Choice (e) is Incorrect.
Choice (f) is Incorrect.
For the linear equation − x − 7 = −x + 5 which of the following moves is correct?
(a)
− x − 7 = −x + 5
  (b)
− y = x + 7 y = −x + 5
(c)
y = x + 7 y = −x + 5
  (d)
y = −x − 7 y = −x + 5

Choice (a) is Correct!
Subtract x from each side of the first equation
Choice (b) is Incorrect.
If Claire is 2 then Betty is 3 and Alice is 6.
Choice (c) is Incorrect.
If Claire is 3 then Betty is 4 and Alice is 8.
Choice (d) is Incorrect.
If Claire is 4 then Betty is 5 and Alice is 10.
